name: Clarion Suites Gateway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to spend a romantic weekend in the city, we wanted a hotel close to everything and Clarion Suites was ideal. As soon as I entered the hotel I was greeted at the front desk by a lovely friendly and very helpful staff member. What a refreshing change to have someone who is smiling, friendly, courteous, helpful and also had a lovely sense of humour.
reviews.title: Customer service was spot on - can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every encounter I had with the staff was excellent and made our stay even more special. The apartment was well maintained, clean and comfortable with the most amazing view of the Yarra River and Crown Casino fireworks which are a must see.
reviews.title: Worst hotel bed I have ever slept in, and most poorly designed bathroom

reviews.text: I travel quite a lot for my work and in the past 12 months have stayed at more than 30plus hotels across Australia, UK & Europe and I have never written a ‘thank you’ to acknowledge outstanding service. However, upon returning home I felt compelled to acknowledge the great stay we had. The staff’s attitude, helpfulness and professionalism is a welcome and much appreciated change. Sure I’ve had good service, but to receive it from all of the staff I encountered during my stay was great.
reviews.title: Good clean Hotel but noisy train lines outside window on Flinders Street

reviews.text: My husband and I are already planning our next weekend getaway and we will definately be staying here again!
reviews.title: Great price on last minute. Friendly staff great location. Very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I honestly cannot fathom why this hotel is so highly rated. Of all the hotels I've stayed at in Melbourne, this one was the least impressive for a number of reasons, the most expensive for no redeeming advantages over others we stayed at on this trip and the only one I've felt compelled to write a negative review of.
reviews.title: Visit to Melbourne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a terrific weekend here in a Two Bedroom Riverview Suite with our friends and found everything perfect. The suite was large and spotlessly clean. Cute little balcony and amazing views from every window. Ample sized kitchen, although we ate out at nearby restaurants most of the time. Enjoyed a few drinks at the Williams Cafe and Bar, and room service never took more than half an hour to arrive ( nothing beats a midnight cheese platter !!) Staff were all helpful, friendly and polite.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is fantastic, walking distance to most places.
reviews.title: Great Room/Great Servicing/Poor Front Office Service

reviews.text: Will definitely stay here again on future Melbourne visits.
reviews.title: Very pleased

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here in late June/early July. When arriving at the hotel the check-in process was rushed and was not very friendly. We stayed for four nights and not once on walking into the hotel or through reception did any staff greet us with a "good evening" or "good morning". The front desk staff seem a little uninterested. When I asked for a shower cap the night staff advised me that they did not have any and to go and see the restaurant!?. I thought this was strange. Although the housekeeping staff do a great job at the cleaning of the room. Our room was perfect. The location was great. My suggestion to management is that they should consider responding to guest questionnaire responses thanking guests for their time and consideration in response. I left a detailed questionnaire and have heard nothing - no feedback - no thank-you. I work in the hotel industry as a front office manager and personally the service was poor. I understand that all hotels are different and staff have their good and bad days BUT we felt let down. Thanks to the FANTASTIC housekeeping staff who always had a smile to offer and had our room serviced to perfection every day,
reviews.title: Great Service made for Great Stay

reviews.text: Had a two night stay here on the 26th & 27th May 2011 with my 93 year old Mum. I'm not a regular user of hotels, but was extremelly impressed with this one. The people at the desk were very friendly and willing to offer service that I didn't expect. We stayed in a studio room, which was very clean. The bathroom was also very clean, although I did think the space outside the shower was a little small. I think we were on the 9th floor, and the view was very nice. I was unfortunatley not that well because I'd managed to get the flu a few days before our trip, but the beds were very comfortable, and I had no problems sleeping. You could hardly here any other noise. The kitchenette was also very clean and had all the necessary needs. The food/wine provided for sale in the room was very expensive so we didn't buy any of that, but I guess thats normal for hotels. We ate at the hotel restuarant one night. The food and service was excellent. The chips I had with my meal were the best I've ever had. Would definatley recommend this hotel
reviews.title: lovely big space, outlook, concierge help, close to city elements

reviews.text: I stayed in this room for a week on business. Its not in a fantastic area of Melbourne (which I knew prior to booking), the rooms were old and musty and need a refurbishment. The rooms were pretty noisy and dark and we were overwhelmed by the smell of someone's chinese food one night. The room service is very expensive and I was going to be charged and additional $3 if I wanted to have both ketchup and mustard on a burger which is a total rort! I wouldn't stay here again, as it was very expensive for what it was.
reviews.title: Not as good as it is made out to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel overnight. Even though for such a short stay, I am very impressed with the the courteous staff at reception and more particlalry the room. Room is excellent and comfrotable..and talk about the views!!!!
reviews.title: Excellent All round

reviews.text: Spent the weekend at the Clarion Suites Gateway booked via Mystery Apartment on Last Minute.com.au. 1 adult, 2 children is hard to get a reasonable priced room for but this property met all our needs!!
reviews.title: Perfect for families

reviews.text: 1br suite with sofa bed - think it was $175 a night - included 2 big TVs - and kitchen and washer/dryer. Take something to swim in, my 8yo daughter loved the indoor heated pool.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: Our room wasnt RiverView but looking over to an office - people actually working at night?? It was very quiet, minimal road noise and the like.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first time we'd stayed at the Clarion Suites Gateway in Melbourne and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The location was terrific, so close to Southbank, Bourke St and Crown.Had we been going to either the M.C.G or Etihad, it would have been perfect too. Tram stop right out front. Our room was great, quiet, comfortable, roomy and overlooked the Yarra, which was a pleasant surprise. We'll definately be back!!
reviews.title: Found a new favourite place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a Studio Room Riverside for a weekend birthday celebration and we had a great view of the river. Southbank and the casino are all lit up at night and It looks fantastic when the large gas flames blow at night outside the casino.
reviews.title: Brilliant river views

reviews.text: It was noisy with the balcony door open but we heard no noise from adjoining rooms. The train also runs alongside the river and you would hear this if the balcony door was open. The balcony was tiny with the airconditioning unit taking up half the space, this also seemed to be making a noise at night.
reviews.title: Overall a good stay

reviews.text: Check in and check out was friendly and efficient. We were given vouchers for discounted meals at the hotel on check in. Hotel parking is $20 per day. There are free newspapers on request.
reviews.title: We loved it and we'll be back!

reviews.text: We had a fairly spacious room with a big comfortable bed. The large TV on the wall would have been better placed in front of the bed as it was difficult to watch for any length of time from the far side of the bed. There is a small kitchenette cleverly hidden in a cupboard with kettle, toaster, microwave and fridge. We had a surprise delivery of free champagne for my husband's birthday. We really appreciated this lovely gesture.
reviews.title: Awesome location, top hotel in every way

description: Contemporary High-rise Hotel situated 200 meters from aquarium & 500 meters from casino, shops & Yarra River Cruises.
